intro: Myrsine novocaledonica, commonly known as the New Caledonian myrsine, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are usually glossy and dark green. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Myrsine novocaledonica is often found in moist, shaded habitats within the tropical rainforests of New Caledonia.
